cleaned_text: spirituality [r/spirituality](/r/spirituality/) Here, we discuss such things as personal transformation, the meaning of life, death, and moments of clarity. There is no single, widely-agreed definition of spirituality. Many people gravitate toward spirituality to seek religious-like understandings without the ideological constraints of institutional religion. This community, however, is open to everyone, religious and non-religious alike. Join us in finding our place in the universe. I feel like in some ways spirituality can get toxic. For instance, someone doesn't want to be friends or be around someone else because they're not "high vibe." They may start cutting people out of their lives because of this. I admit at the beginning of my spiritual journey I was doing this. I may have thought somehow I was better than others. I was cutting a lot of people out of my life because they weren't exactly positive people. By cutting people out I mean unfriending former co-workers on Facebook. When I took a step back I realized the damage I had done. If I felt lonely I only had myself to blame because a lot of people were gone.
